intro: Asperula praevistita, commonly known as the early bluebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and rocky slopes. Asperula praevistita is known for its early blooming period, often appearing in late winter or early spring.
